SafeCopy<TObj, TProp>(IConfiguration, TObj, Expression<Func<TObj, TProp>>, String, Boolean) This method safely copies a value from the specified key of the configuration to the property on the target oject using a LINQ expression to identify the property to change. If the configuration key is missing, or the value is NULL, then no copy operation is performed - unless the allowSetNulls property is set to TRUE. Declaration public static IConfiguration SafeCopy<TObj, TProp>(this IConfiguration configuration, TObj target, Expression<Func<TObj, TProp>> selector, string key, bool allowSetNulls = false) where TObj : class Parameters Type Name Description Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration.IConfiguration configuration The configuration to use for the operation. TObj target The target object to use for the operation. System.Linq.Expressions.Expression < System.Func <TObj, TProp>> selector The LINQ expression to use for the operation. System.String key The configuration key to use for the operation. System.Boolean allowSetNulls Indicates whether to allow a NULL value to be copied to the specified property on the target object. Returns Type Description Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration.IConfiguration The value of the configuration parameter. Type Parameters Name Description TObj The target object type. TProp The target property type.
